DOC.brief_title: Mindfulness-Based Exercise Video Educating Hispanic/Latino Patients With Colorectal Cancer Their Caregivers
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate effect brief educational program colorectal cancer knowledge acquisition 3-arm randomized clinical trial ( Control Group : standard care ; Treatment Group 1 : cancer education ; Treatment Group 2 : mindfulness + cancer education ) compare visual/written educational material without mindfulness train standard care . II . To determine prim effect brief mindfulness training retain knowledge colorectal cancer education . III . To determine joint effect colorectal cancer education deliver patient caregiver overall colorectal cancer knowledge . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To examine relative change psychobiological variable ( stress , anxiety , depression , mindfulness , fatigue , life benefit ) pre ( T0 ) post ( T1 ) intervention 3 arm clinical trial . II . To measure change salivary cortisol level indicator acute stress reactivity across 4 time point across one-hour period ( i.e. , 0 min , 20 min , 40 min , 60 min ) active chemotherapy ( T1 ) . III . To determine moderate effect baseline peripheral level inflammation ( interleukin-1 [ IL-1 ] , IL-6 , c-reactive protein [ CRP ] tumor necrosis factor alpha [ TNFa ] ) trajectory salivary cortisol reactivity . OUTLINE : Patients caregiver randomize 1 3 group . GROUP I : Patients caregiver receive standard care . GROUP II : Patients caregiver receive 20-minute self-playing interactive educational video brochure . GROUP III : Patients caregiver receive 20-minute self-playing interactive educational video brochure watch 20-minute interactive mindfulness exercise video .
